title: Christmas trivia; The ten-day quiz: part 4
text:
Set 71. Which performer in the Star Wars movies was the daughter of Debbie Reynolds, an actress and singer?2. Which song by Tammy Wynette was ranked number 1 in Country Music Television's list of greatest country songs in a 2003 poll?3. Which Massachusetts town was gripped by a series of witch trials in 1692 and 1693?4. What term was devised by Arthur Okun, an economist, to describe a measure that added the unemployment rate to the inflation rate?5. What was the name of the communist guerrilla group founded in Peru by Abimael Guzmán?

What theme connects these answers?Set 81. Who was the first African American woman elected to the US senate?2. Which American actor formed one half of a double act with a performer whose real name was Arthur Stanley Jefferson?3. Which Christmas carol was based on a poem by Christina Rossetti, set to music by Gustav Holst?4. Which British newspaper was founded as the Daily Universal Register in 1785?5. What term is used in America for professionally-managed open-ended investment pools that allow small investors to own a wide range of financial securities?

What theme connects these answers?

---

These are the answers to yesterday's questions:

Set 5: David Tennant, Earl Grey, Shirley Chisholm, Jane Fonda and “In the Heights”.

The theme is novels by the Brontës: “The Tenant of Wildfell Hall”, “Agnes Grey”, “Shirley”, “Jane Eyre” and “Wuthering Heights”.

Set 6: Ronald Reagan, Indira Gandhi, John Lennon, Louis Armstrong, Charles de Gaulle.

They have all had airports named after them: Washington, New Delhi, Liverpool, New Orleans and Paris.
